article_heading: Crypto for Advisors: The Growth of Bitcoin as Collateral
description: The image you've provided is a line graph titled "Bitcoin Spot ETF Cumulative Flow (US$M)." This graph is a visual representation of the cumulative flow of Bitcoin ETF, which is a type of exchange-traded fund that tracks the price of Bitcoin. The graph is set against a white background with a grid that helps in understanding the scale of the data.  The graph is color-coded to represent different ETFs, each with a unique color. The ETFs are listed on the right side of the graph, with their corresponding colors and names. The ETFs include GrayScale, Bitwise, WisdomTree, Valkyrie, Invesco, and VanEck. Each ETF has a line on the graph, indicating its performance over time.  The x-axis of the graph represents time, with dates ranging from 01 Mar 2024 to 01 Jul 2024. The y-axis represents the value of the ETFs in millions of US dollars, with values ranging from 0 to 40,000.  The graph shows the performance of each ETF over the specified time period. Some ETFs have a higher cumulative flow than others, indicating that they have performed better in terms of value. The graph provides a visual comparison of the performance of these ETFs, helping investors and analysts understand the market trends and make informed decisions.
